name: Get a Good Tan! Quiz | Words Within Words | 10 Questions

questions.text: What word, beginning with TAN, can describe an arrangement of two people or things, one behind the other?
questions.explanation:
tandem.

	You'll look sweet upon the seat of a bicycle built for two.

questions.text: What word, beginning with TAN, can describe something that is capable of being touched?
What word, beginning with TAN, can describe a small American bird?
What word, beginning with TAN, can describe a fruit?
questions.explanation:
tangelo.

	A cross between a grapefruit and a tangerine.

questions.text: What word, beginning with TAN, can describe an ancient Chinese puzzle?
questions.explanation:
tangram & tangoes.

	Kids use plastic tangram shapes in school math these days--helps them learn geometry.

questions.text: What word, beginning with TAN, can describe an African nation
questions.explanation:
Tanzania.

	It is on the Indian Ocean, south of Kenya.

questions.text: What word, beginning with TAN, can describe a city of northern Morocco?
questions.explanation:
Tangier & Tangiers.

	It was founded in Roman times.

questions.text: What word, beginning with TAN, can describe a sudden, irrelevant digression?
questions.explanation:
tangent.

	I'm ALWAYS going off on tangents. The Internet encourages that. Have you noticed?

questions.text: What word, beginning with TAN, can mean to snarl?
questions.explanation:
tangle.

	There's a Tanglewood Music Festival in Massachusetts. (See, I just went off on a tangent.)

questions.text: What word, beginning with TAN, can be used to say that something is equivalent in effect or value?
questions.explanation:
tantamount.

	This is tantamount to that.
